required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Murine CD19 CAR-T Therapy for Patients With Relapsed or Refractory CD19+ B-cell Hematological Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial for the Safety and Efficacy of Murine CD19 CAR-T Cells Therapy for Patients With Relapsed and/or Refractory B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia and B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: A Study of Murine CD19 CAR-T Cells Therapy for Patients With Relapsed or Refractory CD19+ B-cell Hematological Malignancies.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, single-center study. This study is indicated for relapsed or refractory CD19+ B-cell hematological malignancies, including acute lymphoblastic leukemia and B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. The selections of dose levels and the number of subjects are based on clinical trials of similar foreign products. Two groups of patients will be enrolled, 36 in each group. Primary objective is to explore the safety, main consideration is dose- related safety.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after murine CD19 targeted CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after murine CD19 targeted CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.measure: B-cell acute lymphocytic leukemia(B-ALL), Overall response rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + CRi) at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after murine CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of murine CD19 CAR-T cells to death or the last visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after murine CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of murine CD19 CAR-T cells to the occurrence of any event, including death, relapse or gene relapse, disease progression (any one occurs first), and the last visit

secondary_outcome.measure: B cell non-hodgkin's lymphoma (B-NHL), Overall response rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + PR) per Lugano 2014 criteria
Assessment of DCR (DCR=CR+PR+SD) per Lugano 2014 criteria

Assessment using European Organisation for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) scale to measure Quality of life at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12
Assessment using Activities of Daily Living (ADL) scale at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) scale at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment using Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

arm_group.arm_group_label: Administration of Murine CD19 CAR T-cells

intervention.description: Each subject receive murine CD19 CAR T-cells by intravenous infusion
intervention.arm_group_label: Administration of Murine CD19 CAR T-cells

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital，College of Medicine, Zhejiang University
